core_exploration.central_question: How do financial incentives drive behavior and business outcomes?
core_exploration.key_tension: Between top-down revenue targets and bottom-up individual motivation
core_exploration.breakthrough_moment: Recognition that $200 creates universal motivation ('who wouldn't be telling their things')
core_exploration.edge_of_understanding: The specific mechanics of how incentive amounts translate to behavioral change and revenue outcomes

conceptual_dna: Financial incentives create predictable behavioral responses when the amount feels significant to the recipient
Top-down revenue planning requires understanding bottom-up individual motivation triggers

bridge_potential.novel_synthesis: Connecting individual psychological motivation thresholds to aggregate business planning
bridge_potential.cross_domain_pattern: Incentive structures create predictable behavioral cascades across systems

raw_essence: A $200 incentive creates universal motivation that drives referral behavior. This connects individual psychological triggers to top-down business revenue planning.
embedding_text: financial incentives behavioral motivation revenue planning referral systems psychological triggers business strategy
